1.title: Development Environment Setup
1.description: Install and configure the essential tools for modern web development.
objectives: Set up Node.js (v20+) and verify npm
Install Git and create a GitHub account
Understand the Cursor interface and AI features

concepts.title: Your Development Environment
concepts.content: Your development environment is the foundation of everything you'll build. We're using modern tools optimized for AI-assisted development.

keyPoints.definition: VS Code fork with native AI integration
JavaScript runtime for build tools and servers
Version control to track changes and collaborate
Package manager for JavaScript libraries

windows.title: Windows Setup Notes
tips: Use Windows Terminal (from Microsoft Store) instead of Command Prompt
PowerShell is the default shell - some commands differ from Mac/Linux
PATH issues are common - restart terminal after installations
Line endings differ (CRLF vs LF) - configure Git accordingly

mac.title: Mac Setup Notes
tips: Terminal app works well, iTerm2 is a popular upgrade
Xcode Command Line Tools required - install when prompted
Homebrew (brew.sh) is the standard package manager
M1/M2 Macs: All tools are Apple Silicon compatible

steps.title: Install Node.js v20+
steps.description: Node.js is the JavaScript runtime that powers modern web development tools.

info.title: Why Node.js?
info.content: Node.js runs JavaScript outside the browser. It powers build tools, package managers, and dev servers.

shared: Go to nodejs.org and download LTS version (v20+)
windows: Run the .msi installer ‚Äî ensure 'Add to PATH' is checked
Close and reopen your terminal after installation
mac: Run the .pkg installer with default settings
Or install via Homebrew: brew install node

steps.successCheck: You should see version numbers like v20.x.x and 10.x.x

windows.title: PATH Not Recognized?
windows.content: If you see 'node is not recognized', restart your computer or reinstall with 'Add to PATH' checked.

steps.title: Install Git & Create GitHub Account
steps.description: Git tracks changes to your code. GitHub hosts your repositories online.

windows: Select 'Use Visual Studio Code' or 'Use Cursor' as default editor
Choose 'Git from the command line and also from 3rd-party software'
Select 'Checkout Windows-style, commit Unix-style' for line endings
mac: Install Xcode Command Line Tools when prompted (may take several minutes)
shared: Create an account at github.com
Configure Git with your info

commands.shared:
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "your@email.com"

steps.successCheck: Run git --version ‚Äî you should see git version 2.x.x

steps.title: Install Cursor IDE
steps.description: Cursor is a VS Code fork with built-in AI coding assistance ‚Äî the primary tool for vibe coding.

info.title: Why Cursor over VS Code?
info.content: Cursor has native AI integration with Claude and GPT models. You can select code and ask questions, get inline suggestions, and have AI write entire functions.

shared: Go to cursor.sh and download for your OS
Launch and sign in (free tier available)
Import VS Code settings if you have them
mac: Open the .dmg file and drag Cursor to Applications

mac.title: Gatekeeper Warning?
mac.content: If you see 'Cursor can't be opened', go to System Preferences ‚Üí Security & Privacy ‚Üí General ‚Üí Click 'Open Anyway'

steps.title: Install Essential Extensions
steps.description: Extensions add features to Cursor. These are essential for modern web development.

shared: Open Extensions with {{modKey}} + Shift + X
Search and install each extension

steps.title: Test Cursor AI Features
steps.description: Let's verify Cursor's AI features work and practice using them.

shared: Create a new folder for your projects
Open this folder in Cursor
Create a new file called test.js
Press {{modKey}} + K to open the AI prompt

aiPrompt.prompt: Create a function that takes an array of numbers and returns the sum, average, min, and max values as an object

followUp: Press Enter and watch Cursor generate the code
Accept the code with Tab or click Accept
Try selecting the code and pressing {{modKey}} + L to chat about it
steps.successCheck: Run node test.js ‚Äî you should see an object with sum, average, min, and max values

deliverable.title: Today's Deliverable
deliverable.description: Cursor IDE running with terminal access, Node.js v20+ installed, Git configured, and successful test of Cursor's AI inline editing feature.

2.title: Claude Code & AI Tools
2.description: Master the command-line AI assistant for complex coding tasks.
objectives: Install Claude Code CLI and authenticate
Understand when to use Claude Code vs Cursor
Complete your first AI-assisted coding task

concepts.title: Cursor vs Claude Code
concepts.content: Top developers use BOTH tools depending on the task complexity.

keyPoints.definition: Flow-state coding in the IDE. Quick edits, inline suggestions, real-time assistance.
Deep reasoning agent. Complex multi-file tasks, refactoring, debugging. Describe a task, walk away, come back to it done.

windows.title: Windows Terminal Tips
tips: Use PowerShell or Windows Terminal, not Command Prompt
May need to run as Administrator for global npm installs
If script execution is blocked, run: Set-ExecutionPolicy -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Scope CurrentUser

mac.title: Mac Terminal Tips
tips: Works great in Terminal or iTerm2
Don't use sudo for npm - fix permissions instead
zsh is the default shell on modern Macs

steps.title: Install Claude Code CLI
steps.description: Claude Code is a command-line tool for agentic coding. It can edit multiple files, run commands, and reason through complex tasks.

windows.title: Permission Error?
windows.content: Run your terminal as Administrator (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)

mac.title: Permission Error?
mac.content:
Don't use sudo. Instead, configure npm prefix:
mkdir ~/.npm-global
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'
echo 'export PATH=~/.npm-global/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.zshrc
source ~/.zshrc

steps.title: Authenticate with Anthropic
steps.description: Claude Code needs to connect to your Anthropic account to work.

info.title: Browser Authentication
info.content: This will open a browser window. Sign in with your Anthropic account (or create one at console.anthropic.com).

steps.successCheck: Run 'claude' in your terminal. You should see the Claude Code interface start up.

steps.title: Learn Essential Commands
steps.description: Here are the commands you'll use most often.

commands.shared:
# Start interactive mode in current directory
claude

# Run a single task
claude "create a React component for a navbar"

# Continue a previous conversation
claude --continue

# Show help
claude --help

tips: Claude Code sees your entire project structure
It can create, edit, and delete files
It can run terminal commands (with your approval)
Be specific in your prompts for best results

steps.title: Your First Claude Code Task
steps.description: Let's create a useful utility script using Claude Code.

aiPrompt.prompt: Create a Node.js script called 'file-organizer.js' that scans the current directory, groups files by extension, and prints a summary showing count and total size for each file type category. Include a --move flag that optionally moves files into folders organized by extension.

followUp: Review Claude's plan before approving file creation
Test the script with: node file-organizer.js

steps.title: Practice Effective Prompting
steps.description: The quality of AI output depends heavily on prompt quality.
tips: Be Specific: Include tech stack, constraints, expected behavior
Provide Context: Mention existing patterns or requirements
Request Explanations: Add 'and explain your approach' to learn
Iterate: Start simple, refine with follow-up prompts

practicePrompts.title: Practice Prompt 1
practicePrompts.prompt: Add error handling to the file-organizer script. It should gracefully handle permission errors and missing directories, logging warnings instead of crashing.

practicePrompts.title: Practice Prompt 2
practicePrompts.prompt: Create a README.md for this project that explains what the script does, how to use it, and includes example output.

deliverable.title: Today's Deliverable
deliverable.description: Claude Code installed and authenticated. A working file-organizer.js script with README.md, created entirely through natural language prompts.

3.title: React Basics Part 1
3.description: Create your first React application and learn the fundamentals.
objectives: Understand what React is and why it's used
Create a React project using Vite

concepts.title: What is React?
concepts.content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces with reusable components.

keyPoints.definition: Building blocks of UI (like LEGO bricks)
HTML-like syntax in JavaScript
Data that changes over time (triggers re-renders)
Data passed from parent to child components

steps.description: Vite is a modern build tool that's faster than Create React App. It's the recommended way to start new React projects.

commands.shared:

cd my-react-app
npm install
npm run dev

osNotes.windows: Unlike Mac, Windows won't automatically open the browser. After running npm run dev, manually open the URL shown (usually http://localhost:5173). You can Ctrl+click the URL in terminal.

steps.successCheck: Open http://localhost:5173 in your browser. You should see the Vite + React starter page with a spinning logo.

8.title: State Management
8.description: Master useReducer and Context API for complex state management.
objectives: Learn useReducer for complex state logic
Implement Context API for global state

concepts.title: When to Use What
concepts.content: Different state tools for different needs. The key is choosing the right tool for your specific situation.

keyPoints.definition: Best for simple, independent values ‚Äî a toggle, a form field, a counter
Best for complex state with multiple sub-values or when next state depends on previous
Best for state that many components need access to ‚Äî theme, user, language
Redux, Zustand, Jotai for large apps with complex requirements

steps.title: useReducer Fundamentals
steps.description: Learn the reducer pattern for predictable state updates.

info.title: Why useReducer?
info.content: When state logic gets complex (multiple related values, complex update logic), useReducer makes it more predictable. All state changes go through a single function with clear action types.

steps.title: Context API Basics
steps.description: Share state across components without prop drilling.

info.title: Prop Drilling Problem
info.content: Without Context, passing state through many component levels is tedious and error-prone. Context lets you 'teleport' data to any component that needs it.

steps.title: Combining useReducer + Context
steps.description: The powerful pattern for app-wide state management.

steps.title: State Management Best Practices
steps.description: Learn patterns to avoid common pitfalls.

info.title: Key Principles
info.content:
1. Keep state as flat as possible ‚Äî avoid deeply nested objects
2. Normalize data ‚Äî store items by ID, reference by ID
3. Derive values instead of storing duplicates (totalPrice computed, not stored)
4. Colocate state ‚Äî keep it close to where it's used
5. Separate UI state from server/data state

concepts.title: Hooks Under the Hood
concepts.content: Hooks allow function components to 'hook into' React state and lifecycle features.

keyPoints.definition: The array at the end of useEffect/useMemo. If these change, the effect runs again.
Function returned by useEffect to clean up event listeners or intervals.
JavaScript functions that start with 'use' and can call other hooks.

steps.title: Mastering useEffect Cleanup

steps.title: Using useRef

info.title: Two Main Uses
info.content:
1. Accessing DOM elements directly (focusing inputs, scrolling).
2. Storing values that persist across renders but DO NOT trigger re-renders.
